member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.GracefulShutdownOptions.Mode
member.summary: This mode defines the server's behavior after receiving a `Ctrl+C` (SIGINT).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.GracefulShutdownOptions.Timeout
member.summary: Specifies the timeout of a graceful shutdown process (in seconds). Default value is 30 seconds.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ServiceHubConnectionContext
member.summary: ServiceHubConnectionContext is only passed to IUserIdProvider.GetUserId as a parameter. Only HttpContext and User properties are available for access. Exception will be thrown when other properties are accessed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ClientConnectionContext
member.summary: The client connection context

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ClientConnectionContext.CancelOutgoing(System.Int32)
member.summary: Cancel the outgoing process

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ServiceOptions
member.summary: Configurable options when using Azure SignalR Service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ServiceOptions.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the connection string of Azure SignalR Service instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ServiceOptions.ConnectionCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial number of connections per hub from SDK to Azure SignalR Service. Default value is 5. Usually keep it as the default value is enough. During runtime, the SDK might start new server connections for performance tuning or load balancing. When you have big number of clients, you can give it a larger number for better throughput.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ServiceOptions.InitialHubServerConnectionCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial number of connections per hub from SDK to Azure SignalR Service. Default value is 5. Usually keep it as the default value is enough. When you have big number of clients, you can give it a larger number for better throughput. During runtime, the SDK might start new server connections for performance tuning or load balancing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ServiceOptions.MaxHubServerConnectionCount
member.summary: Specifies the max server connection count allowed per hub from SDK to Azure SignalR Service. During runtime, the SDK might start new server connections for performance tuning or load balancing. By default a new server connection starts whenever needed. When the max allowed server connection count is configured, the SDK does not start new connections when server connection count reaches the limit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ServiceOptions.ApplicationName
member.summary: Gets applicationName, which will be used as a prefix to apply to each hub name. Should be prefixed with alphabetic characters and only contain alpha-numeric characters or underscore.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ServiceOptions.ClaimsProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets the func to generate claims from . The claims will be included in the auto-generated token for clients.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ServiceOptions.DiagnosticClientFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets the func to set diagnostic client filter from . The clients will be regarded as diagnostic client only if the function returns true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ServiceOptions.AccessTokenLifetime
member.summary: Gets or sets the lifetime of auto-generated access token, which will be used to authenticate with Azure SignalR Service. Default value is one hour.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ServiceOptions.AccessTokenAlgorithm
member.summary: Gets or sets the access token generate algorithm, supports or Default value is

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ServiceOptions.Endpoints
member.summary: Gets or sets list of endpoints

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ServiceOptions.ServerStickyMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode for server sticky, when client is always routed to the server which it first /negotiate with, we call it "server sticky mode". By default it is disabled

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ServiceOptions.GracefulShutdown
member.summary: Specifies if the client-connection assigned to this server can be migrated to another server. Default value is 0. 1: Only migrate client-connection if server was shutdown gracefully. 2: Migrate client-connection even if server-connection was accidentally dropped. (Potential data losses)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ServiceOptions.Proxy
member.summary: Gets or sets the proxy used when ServiceEndpoint will attempt to connect to Azure SignalR.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ServiceOptions.ServiceScaleTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets timeout waiting when scale multiple Azure SignalR Service endpoints. Default value is 5 minutes

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ServiceOptions.MaxPollIntervalInSeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval in seconds used by the Azure SignalR Service to timeout idle LongPolling connections. Default value is 5, limited to [1, 300].

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.ServiceOptions.TransportTypeDetector
member.summary: Gets or sets a function which accepts and returns a bitmask combining one or more values that specify what transports the service should use to receive HTTP requests.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.SignalR.MemoryBufferWriter.CompletedBuffer
member.summary: Holds a byte[] from the pool and a size value. Basically a Memory but guaranteed to be backed by an ArrayPool byte[], so that we know we can return it.
